addressleaf.section:
To the right honorable S
r
Francis Walsingham knight, Principall Secretary to her Ma
tie
.

21 Feb
r
1589
From M
r
Boodley at
e
Hage
e
LL.
letters of
e 4 Ja
n
received
e g
nral
muster desired shalbe taken, as sone as conveniently it may, being now differred by reason of
e imploym
e
t of
S
r
Francis Vere
.
Instructions sent d
s
liked by
e
Counsel of state
w
th
some alteration.

page.lettertext:
It may please yo
r
H. to be advertised, that the
letter from my LL. of
e Councell, bearing date the 4
of Ja
n
and an other from yo
r
H. of
e 15 of
e same
moneth, are but newly come unto me. I have
acquainted
e Councell of state w
t
her
Ma
ties
pleasure,
for a muster generall of all her forces in these contreis
following those Instructions, w
ch
I recea ved from my
LL. W
ch
they doe willingly accept, w
t
some smalle
alteration, and will execute accordingly. But as
nowe
e opportunitie doth not serve, for many respectes,
chiefly, for
at S
r
Francis Vere hath some part of his
troupes w
t
Count Maurice
, and
e rest at
Does-
bourgh
. Howbeit they resolve to doe it, assoone as
may be: wherof I beseche yo
r
H. to advertise my
LL. and when
e muster is perfourmed, what-
soever is needefull, shall be certified further.
I thanke yo
r
H. most humbly, for moving her Ma
tie
about my returne, whiche I would request but
for a moneth, and take an opportunitie, when it
should be no prejudice to her Ma
ties
service. I
will not importune yo
r
H. to move it any more, but
if her Ma
tie
were so gracious unto me, it would
steede me greatly in my privat estate. Of Count
Maurice attempt to surprise
e towne of
Breda
,
I have written heerew
t
unto my
L. Treasuro
r
, w
t
some other occurrence, w
ch
I doe not dout but his L.
will impart w
t
yo
r
H.
and so I take my humble
leave. From
e Hage. Fe
b
21. 89
Yo
r
H. most humbly bounden Tho. Bodley.
